title: How to Cuff Jeans (Disheveled)

steps.headline: Select a pair of jeans (or casual trousers), shoes and socks that go well together.
steps.description: The ankle area will be accentuated by the cuff, so make sure that the pair you have selected works well with your overall aesthetic. Alternatively, try going sock-less. This style is perfect for less formal or hotter environments.

steps.headline: Roll the cuff tightly several times to establish a rounded shape.
steps.description: The cuff should reveal roughly 2-4" (5-10cm) of your ankle.

steps.headline: Firmly holding the inner side of the cuff, continue to roll the outside with a twisting motion.
steps.description: This should create a haphazard look (you want this).

steps.headline: Check the height and general look of your cuff.

text: Select a pair of jeans (or casual trousers), shoes and socks that go well together. The ankle area will be accentuated by the cuff, so make sure that the pair you have selected works well with your overall aesthetic. Alternatively, try going sock-less. This style is perfect for less formal or hotter environments. Put on socks and pants.  Roll the cuff tightly several times to establish a rounded shape. The cuff should reveal roughly 2-4" (5-10cm) of your ankle. Firmly holding the inner side of the cuff, continue to roll the outside with a twisting motion. This should create a haphazard look (you want this). Check the height and general look of your cuff. Make adjustments as necessary.
